oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Louisville and Nashville Railroad Company Land and Emigrant Department Circular
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Maps; Mineral deposits; Minerals; Geology
Agriculture
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: This 1890 circular, put together by Land and Immigrant Agent W.M. Janes under the auspices of the Louisville and Nashville Railroad Company Land and Emigrant Department, focuses on iron ore lands along the L& N in Tennessee and Kentucky counties available for immigration. He includes an article and accompanying map by J. B. Killebrew that previously appeared in the Engineering and Mining Journal. Available farm lands and timber lands in the areas are also noted.
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Louisville and Nashville Railroad Company. Land and Emigrant Dept.
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: This circular points up the connection that existed between the railroad companies and the development of agriculture, natural resources, and industrialization. It definitely behoved the railroad companies to encourage immigration and the sale of ore, farm, and timber lands along their lines. J. B. Killbrew focused on iron, coal, and railroad interests following his departure from the Bureau of Agriculture in 1880, and he would become an agent for the NC&St.L Railroad in 1894.
